medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hyperthyroidism in patient A was recognized at the age of 5.5 years. The mother identified her daughter as slightly irritable. At age 11 years, the thyroid gland remained not enlarged. Blood pressure and heart rate were slightly elevated, prompting treatment with antithyroid medication.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The mother was diagnosed with nonautoimmune hyperthyroidism and is under treatment with thiamazole (10 mg/d). The father has mild hyperthyroidism with a goiter.
medical_history.family_history: The mother carries the same Cys636Trp mutation. The father has a history of mild hyperthyroidism with a goiter.
